snippet.title: The Raven \- Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia
snippet.description: "The Raven" is a narrative poem by American writer Edgar Allan Poe. First published in January 1845, the poem is often noted for its musicality, stylized language, and supernatural atmosphere.

snippet.title: The Raven : the poem - Edgar Allan Poe
snippet.description: The Raven by Edgar Allan Poe. First Published in 1845. Once upon a midnight dreary, while I pondered, weak and weary, Over many a quaint and curious volume of forgotten lore,

snippet.title: Edgar Allan Poe: The Raven \- heise online
snippet.description: Once upon a midnight dreary, while I pondered weak and weary, Over many a quaint and curious volume of forgotten lore, While I nodded, nearly napping, suddenly there came a tapping,

snippet.title: The Raven by Edgar Allan Poe- Poets.org - Poetry, Poems, Bios ...
snippet.description: The Raven by Edgar Allan Poe read by Anne Waldman: Once upon a midnight dreary, while I pondered, weak and weary, Over many a quaint and curious volume of forgotten lore— While I nodded, nearly napping, suddenly there came a tapping, As of some one gently rapping, rapping at my chamber door ...

snippet.title: The Raven (2012) - IMDb
snippet.description: Directed by James McTeigue. With John Cusack, Luke Evans, Alice Eve, Brendan Gleeson. When a madman begins committing horrific murders inspired by Edgar Allan Poe's works, a young Baltimore detective joins forces with Poe to stop him from making his stories a reality.

snippet.description: Once upon a midnight dreary, while I pondered, weak and weary, Over many a quaint and curious volume of forgotten lore--While I nodded, nearly napping, suddenly there came a tapping,
